comments.body:
This is done at the beginning of chapters for kubeadm init and kubeadm join.
Please note that kubeadm join considers only JoinConfiguration (kubeadm reads from the cluster KubeProxyConfiguration and KubeletConfiguration, but the user doesn't have to provide them via config file)

i was wondering about this.
so in a case someone wants to provide a custom KubeletConfiguration for a worker node, can they still include KubeletConfiguration next to their JoinConfiguration separated with ---?

No
KubeletConfiguration can be used only for cluster wide kubelet settings and it is processed only by kubeadm init.
If you want to customize kubelet configuration on a node basis you can use kubelet extra args into the joinconfiguration.noderegistration object.

one problem with the kubelet extra args is that some of them (most of them?) are being deprecated in favor of the kubelet config file usage.

would that leave us in a situation where worker nodes cannot customize the kubelet configuration?

This PR focuses on documenting v1alpha3, so this is out of scope.
But if there is a plan for flag deprecation, what you are saying should be definitely included in v1beta1 redesign.

> This PR focuses on documenting v1alpha3, so this is out of scope.

yes, this is outside of the context of this PR,

> But if there is a plan for flag deprecation, what you are saying should be definitely included in v1beta1 redesign.

100%

[1]
yep, these names do not match the struct types and are misleading. :\
https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/master/cmd/kubeadm/app/apis/kubeadm/v1alpha3/types.go#L116

my vote would be to make them match.

Although in the future the users may have the choice to store different `kind`s in different YAML files, currently we don't. So this must be single YAML file and we should emphasize on that here.
Also, InitConfiguration and JoinConfiguration cannot share a single YAML file at the moment (kubeadm bails out). So we should probably mention that too. Not sure for ClusterConfiguration and JoinConfiguration though.

> Not sure for ClusterConfiguration and JoinConfiguration though.

yeah, we probably want to handle all scenarios.
to exclude the possibility of related `k/kubeadm` issue reports, that is.
i'll add some additional text to catch edge cases.
